CatDescriptText: Stage Blair, retired worker, 2339-1/2 Webster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 7, 1959, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think that the Wacs and others women's units, with the exception of nurses, should be abolished in armed services during peacetime? Why?" answer reads: "Today the children are their bosses and they run around, don't go to church or Sunday School, and stay up late at night.  And the biggest reason is because of barroom parents."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Stage Blair wearing dark overcoat , light colored jacket, and hat with band, standing in front of textured wall with store windows, left window with advertisement inscribed "Palisade..Tue..Oct...vs. Williams"
